data.title: Great place for a bite to eat and some coffee
data.text: Love coming to this place for the great staff and wonderful food. They are known for their coffee, and for a person who doesn't like coffee their Chia latte is a great subsitution. But if you are a coffee drinker you should definitely try this place. Food is always wonderful, most times I have to get an order of the French toast simple but amazingly good :)

data.title: Not their best location, but still good
data.text: Cafe Brazil has been one of my family's regular haunts for years. The Carrolton site is good, but not as good as some of the others around Dallas. We go there mostly out of convenience. The service is hit or miss, but todays service was definitely an improvement from previous experiences and the server was friendly and attentive. The food is not quite Brazilian, but good, except for the seasoned potatoes that end up as a side for almost every dish. I really wish they would amend that instead of charging for substitutions. The coffee is excellent and you can buy different quantities and flavors on site.

data.title: Not Brazilian food!
data.text: Very disappointed as the name prepares you for Brazilian food and yet it is a regular American coffee shop. As the manager told me when I asked, "The closest we get to Brazilian food is our Columbian style coffee." Very bad answer !!!!

data.title: Great Coffee, Trendy Restaurant
data.text: Great selection of good coffee and nice menu. Not too pricey and good service. Open seating and interesting people. Not fancy but friendly and bright.

data.title: Two Best Items On The Menu?
data.text: Great coffee. And the very best veggie sandwich with avocado and rustic bread that I have ever had anywhere. Something for everyone here, even if you are gluten sensitive or doing Weight Watchers! Texas sized portions. Casual service matches casual atmosphere. But no one rushes you here. Good place to congregate with friends to chat, but would say not a date night place...although casual date brunch appropriate.

data.title: Did not honor menu prices
data.text: Today I had a meal at the Café Brazil on Josey Lane in Carrollton, Tx.  I ordered a Brazilian Burger that was priced at $8.29 on the menu and upgraded to Sweet Potato French Fries that was priced at $1.39 extra. When the bill came, the charge for the burger was $9.99 plus the $1.39 for the sweet potato fries.  I questioned the charge for the burger.  The waitress took the ticket and asked the manager about the increased charge. She came back and said the manager had taken off the $1.39 for the upgraded fries but left the burger charge at $9.99.  I had a problem with that because the difference between the menu price ($8.29) was $1.70 less than the $9.99 I was charged for the burger because I was still shorted 31 cents.  I questioned it but did not make a scene.  The 31 cents is a small amount of money but the bigger issue was that Café Brazil did not honor the menu price for its food. Lesson for customers:  Always check to make certain the charge on the bill is the same as on the menu.  Suggestion for the Café Brazil corporate office:  Provide training on the necessity of charging the correct price.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Nice place to go for lunch. If you are in a rush skip it between the service and the food you will be there  quite a while. Food was very good the staff very inattentive having too much fun with each other not paying attention to the tables

data.title: Excellent breakfast, coffee!!
data.text: My brother-in-law eats here all the time, and he can eat wherever he wants to.  He took me there for breakfast, and it DID NOT disappoint!  The eggs were great, the coffee fantastic, and the homemade bread is out of this world.  Great service, great experience.

data.title: Nice plates
data.text: Family members live in the area and we met them for breakfast. They have a great menu and the price was pefect. I found out they give teachers a discount. I'm not sure if that's just for local teachers,  but it was a pleasant suprise, since one of our guest was a teacher. The food was very tasteful with great portions. I'm not a coffee drinker,  but the smell was phenomenal. I believe that is one of their claims to fame. We will definitely try it again when we visit.

data.title: Excellent coffee in a fun restaurant
data.text: I often meet friends here for coffee, tea, and a lunch. I enjoy the wide selection of healthy entrees. The coffee is excellent. The atmosphere is colorful and enjoyable!

data.title: Regular!!!!
data.text: Have a huge and affordable menu, but the food is just regular.  The also have a good selection of coffee and they sale it by pounds.

data.title: Thoroughly disappointed again
data.text:
My family has visited this restaurant quite frequently since it opened more than a decade ago. It has been "our" outpost of this chain and we were thrilled to have it in our community in which we have lived for years. 
That all has changed in the last year or so. Over the last several visits both the service and the cooking have been inconsistent and lacking at times. Today was the last straw.
We were three who arrived less than thirty seconds apart. No one was at the hostess stand and there were a few free tables. I was acknowledged from behind the bar, and asked how many. As soon as I replied, a young lady came forward. We indicated a specific table and were led there without word. She did not even pause enough to receive a "thank you" from us and never turned around. Two or three minutes later, two servers tried to deliver food to us. We told them we had not yet ordered. Yet again we were approached with food by another server, and again told them we had not yet ordered. 
We chatted, then noticed that several tables around us had now left and been cleared, yet no one has come to offer to take even a drink order. It was now 15 minutes from when we had been sat down at a clearly visible table. There were now many empty tables around us. One of our party got up to ask for a server. He stood at the counter and was not acknowledged at first. He asked who was serving us and was again ignored by two servers who simply walked by as if he weren't there. A gentleman appeared. This was the manager on duty Vic. Apparently some list was now consulted to see who was to serve our party, though he was still not acknowledged. On his sitting back down, we waited a minute more or so, then got up and left.
I am extremely sad that this was the outcome of a visit that was actually planned to celebrate a birthday, it shouldn't be the outcome of any of our visits. I am further disappointed that a lovely place that is in our community will not be receiving support from those who have lived in the community for more than four decades. We will be taking our business to a restaurant that values us as customers from now on. Our good intentions and time were wasted on a place that does not value them.
Please be forewarned.

data.title: Best fajita Salad
data.text: I love cafe brazil, I always have a good time and enjoy the nice environment, today was especially chill and relaxed, Ivan our waiter was very attentive and helpful! Forgive the mess in the picture I couldn't wait to dig in haha

data.title: amendment to rating
data.text: I wait to write a review until I have had multiple visits and even longer to change a review. Some of the best remains but others need reevaluation. The menu, prices and friendly wait staff are goodish. When your favorite items on the menu are still there but not prepared as well it is hard to give full credit. When the main theme of the cafe is endless and varied coffee cups running completely out of decaf coffee is hard to award good marks. Wait persons who despite having few patrons to serve seem in a hurry to place the order but not to retrieve the food and bring it to your table while it's still hot don't get extra credit for a friendly demeanor. All these flaws are not a sign of weak training when they only occur periodically. That blame falls to management who are responsible for the consistency of good service. It is disappointing to experience average where once you enjoyed excellence near perfection.  I am at two strikes and delaying the third pitch to avoid having this previously favorite spot from being stricken off the list of "go to" spots.

data.title: coffie and tasty food
data.text: They have gourmet coffees, drink all you want.  Wide variety of food offers form breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  My favorite is the breakfast rellano.

data.title: Great breakfast or lunch stop!
data.text: The coconut chicken salad has brought me back to this quaint, Bohemian dig for years.  My best friend loves to order the crepes when we meet here.  There are delicious homemade desserts and a wide selection of coffees.  While the tables and seating are not anything to write home about, the friendly staff more than make up for it.  I eat here at least once a month.

data.title: breakfast in Brazil
data.text: I have eaten here several times but only for breakfast. They have a great menue though for lunch and dinner, it not cheap here, mid to high range, food is good they are friendly and can accomodate wheel chairs.

data.title: Same as always...which is just fine.
data.text: I've eaten at several other locations and the food is always very consistent and always very good. You pretty much know what you're going to get every time you go into a cafe Brazil location. They have an excellent menu and serve breakfast all day.

data.title: Not what it used to be
data.text: We were thrilled when we got our very own Cafe Brazil 10 or so years ago and visited quite frequently. Unfortunately, within the last year or so, the quality has declined markedly. Lack of attention to cooking, under seasoning, produce past its peak and what appear to be smaller portions. Our hope is that things improve soon.

data.title: casual family breakfast
data.text: The menu offers lots of choices that bring out the country boy happy that stays locked up until I've had my coffee and eggs. Here I get a choice of countries. The empanada with chorizo or huevos rancheros starts my day off "bueno" or the chicken fried steak and eggs reminds me of hearty breakfasts that grandma made. The large cups and wide selection of flavors let me get my coffee on full tilt. Off hours help to avoid a wait and breakfast is always on the menu.
